author: talkSPORT
title: Former Chelsea owner Ken Bates criticised for 'sniff of money in the air' comments on racial abuse allegations at club
description: Ken Bates has been criticised for his reaction to the allegations of racial abuse at Chelsea by saying "the sniff of money is in their air". The 86-year-old owned Chelsea from 1982 until June 2003, which was during the period in which former youth team players claim they were racially abuse by two coaches. The club are investigating these allegations.  Bates was asked by the Proper Sport Daily podcast about the abuse allegations concerning Graham Rix and Gwyn Williams. Both men vehemently deny all the allegations.
